clinical_study.brief_title: Registry of Patients With Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension in Novosibirsk Region
clinical_study.official_title: Local Registry of Patients With Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension in Novosibirsk Region

lead_sponsor.agency: Novosibirsk Scientific Research Institute for Circulatory Pathology

clinical_study.source: Novosibirsk Scientific Research Institute for Circulatory Pathology

brief_summary.textblock: There will be assessment of patients after acute pulmonary embolism for the development of CTEPH

detailed_description.textblock:
There will be assessment of patients after acute pulmonary embolism for the development of CTEPH.
There will be analysis of case histories of 40 patients with acute pulmonary embolism. All this patients will be clinically assessed by local cardiologist. Also echocardiography, lung VQ scans (perfusion and ventilation) will be performed.
Patients with chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension will be assessed by local team experienced in CTEPH treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: clinical presentation of chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension
primary_outcome.description: presence of dyspnea after acute pulmonary embolism will be the sign of clinical symptomatic patients. Dyspnea will be assessed with Borg scale

primary_outcome.measure: clinical presentation of chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension
primary_outcome.description: clinical assessment of physical capacity of patient with 6 minute walking distance test and NYHA functional class

secondary_outcome.measure: presence of pulmonary hypertension - mean pulmonary artery pressure > 25 mm Hg according to echocardiography
secondary_outcome.description: presence of pulmonary hypertension - mean pulmonary artery pressure > 25 mm Hg according to echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: presence of perfusion deficit in pulmonary artery according to VQ scan
secondary_outcome.description: presence of perfusion deficit in pulmonary artery according to VQ scan

intervention.description: Patients from this group will be assessed by cardiologist, echocardiography and VQ scanning

study_pop.textblock: Patients are survivors after acute PE. Than they should intake anticoagulation treatment at least 3-4 month. Then they will be assessed clinically by local cardiologists, echocardiography and VQ scan will be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who had episodes of acute pulmonary embolism
- 3-4 months of anticoagulation treatment after acute pulmonary embolism
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
